member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.BlockApi
member.summary: Manages the raw IPFS blocks.
member.remarks:
An IPFS Block is a byte sequence that represents an IPFS Object (i.e. serialized byte buffers). It is useful to talk about them as "blocks" in Bitswap and other things that do not care about what is being stored.
It is also possible to store arbitrary stuff using ipfs block put/get as the API does not check for proper IPFS Object formatting.
This may be very good or bad, we haven't decided yet ðŸ˜„
This API is accessed via the property.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.BlockApi.GetAsync(Ipfs.Cid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a raw IPFS block.
member.param: Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
The of the block.

member.summary: Stores a byte array as a raw IPFS block.
member.param: The byte array to send to the IPFS network.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.summary: Stores a raw IPFS block.
member.param: The to send to the IPFS network.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.summary: Remove a raw IPFS block.

If true do not raise exception when does not exist. Default value is false.
member.returns: The awaited Task will return the deleted or if the hash does not exist and is true.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient
member.summary: A client that allows access to the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS).
member.remarks: The API is based on the IPFS commands.
IpfsClient is thread safe, only one instance is required by the application.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.IdAsync(Ipfs.MultiHash,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Information about an IPFS peer.
member.param: The id of the IPFS peer. If not specified (e.g. null), then the local peer is used.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.VersionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the version information of the API server.

member.name: F:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.DefaultApiUri
member.summary: The default URL to the IPFS HTTP API server.
member.remarks: The environment variable "IpfsHttpApi" overrides this value.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class and sets the default values.
member.remarks: All methods of IpfsClient are thread safe. Typically, only one instance is required for an application.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class and specifies the API host's URL. default values
member.param: The URL of the API host. For example "http://localhost:5001" or "http://ipv4.fiddler:5001".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.ApiUri
member.summary: The URL to the IPFS API server. The default is "http://localhost:5001".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.UserAgent
member.summary: The value of HTTP User-Agent header sent to the API server.
member.value: The default value is "net-ipfs/M.N", where M is the major and N is minor version numbers of the assembly.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.TrustedPeers
member.summary: The list of peers that are initially trusted by IPFS.
member.remarks: This is equilivent to ipfs bootstrap list.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Api.IpfsClient.PinnedObjects
member.summary: The list of objects that are permanently stored on the local host.
member.remarks: This is equilivent to ipfs pin ls.

member.summary: Provides access to the Block API.

member.summary: Provides access to the Config API.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.PinApi
member.summary: Manages pinned objects (local stored and permanent).
member.remarks:
This API is accessed via the property.
Pinned objects are locally stored and never garbage collected.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinApi.AddAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds an IPFS object to the pinset and also stores it to the IPFS repo. pinset is the set of hashes currently pinned (not gc'able).
member.param: A path to an existing object, such as "QmXarR6rgkQ2fDSHjSY5nM2kuCXKYGViky5nohtwgF65Ec/about" or "QmZTR5bcpQD7cFgTorqxZDYaew1Wqgfbd2ud9QqGPAkK2V"
true to recursively pin links of object; otherwise, false to only pin the specified object. Default is true.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinApi.ListAsync(Ipfs.Api.PinMode,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: List all the objects pinned to local storage.
member.param: The type of pinned objects to return. Defaults to .
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinApi.RemoveAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Unpin an object.
member.param: A path to an existing object, such as "QmXarR6rgkQ2fDSHjSY5nM2kuCXKYGViky5nohtwgF65Ec/about" or "QmZTR5bcpQD7cFgTorqxZDYaew1Wqgfbd2ud9QqGPAkK2V"
true to recursively unpin links of object; otherwise, false to only unpin the specified object. Default is true.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.PubSubApi
member.summary: Allows you to publish messages to a given topic, and also to subscribe to new messages on a given topic.
member.remarks:
This API is accessed via the property.
This is an experimental feature. It is not intended in its current state to be used in a production environment.
To use, the daemon must be run with '--enable-pubsub-experiment'.

member.param: When specified, only peers pubsubing on the topic are returned.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A sequence of for each peer ID.

member.param: The topic name.
The message to publish.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.

member.summary: Subscribe to messages on a given topic.

The action to perform when a is received.
Is used to stop the topic listener. When cancelled, the is NOT raised.
member.returns: After the topic listener is register with the IPFS server.
member.remarks: The is invoked on the topic listener thread.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.MerkleNode
member.summary: The IPFS MerkleDag is the datastructure at the heart of IPFS. It is an acyclic directed graph whose edges are hashes.
member.remarks: Initially an MerkleNode is just constructed with its Cid. Its other properties are lazily loaded.

member.summary: The method used to pin an IPFS object.

member.summary: Pin the specific object, and indirectly pin all its decendants

member.summary: Pin the specific object.

member.name: F:Ipfs.Api.PinMode.Indirect
member.summary: Pinned indirectly by an ancestor (like a refcount)

member.summary: All

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection
member.summary: A list of pinned object.
member.remarks: This is the list of objects that are permanently stored on the local host. ipfs pin command.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Add(Ipfs.Cid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pin an object.
member.param: The of the object.
True to also pin the object's links; False to just pin the object. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs pin add id.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Clear
member.summary: Remove all the trusted peers.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs bootstrap rm --all.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Contains(Ipfs.Cid)
member.summary: Determines if the collection contains a with the specified id.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Remove(Ipfs.Api.PinnedObject)
member.summary: Remove the pinned object.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs pin rm id.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Remove(Ipfs.Cid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unpin an object.
member.param: The of the object.
True to also unpin the object's links; False to just unpin the object. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs pin rm id.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.PinnedCollection.Refresh
member.summary: Ask IPFS for the pinned objects.

member.param: The JSON representation of a published message.

member.summary: The sender of the message.

member.summary: The topics of the message.

member.summary: The sequence number of the message.

member.summary: Contents as a stream of bytes.
member.value: The contents as a stream of bytes.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Api.PublishedMessage.DataString
member.summary: Contents as a string.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Api.TrustedPeerCollection
member.summary: A list of trusted peers.
member.remarks: This is the list of peers that are initially trusted by IPFS. Its equivalent to the ipfs bootstrap command.
member.returns: A series of . Each address ends with an IPNS node id, for example "/ip4/104.131.131.82/tcp/4001/ipfs/QmaCpDMGvV2BGHeYERUEnRQAwe3N8SzbUtfsmvsqQLuvuJ".

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.TrustedPeerCollection.AddDefaultNodes
member.summary: Add the default bootstrap nodes to the trusted peers.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs bootstrap add --default.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.TrustedPeerCollection.Clear
member.summary: Remove all the trusted peers.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs bootstrap rm --all.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Api.TrustedPeerCollection.Remove(Ipfs.MultiAddress)
member.summary: Remove the trusted peer.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs bootstrap rm peer.
